title: fix: edge cases for matchspec parsing
body: Fixes parsing of `blas *.* mkl` and `pytorch=*=cuda*` which would both cause panics.

title: feat: spawn blocking patching operation
body:
We noticed that when downloading multiple channels with JLAP files they would be downloaded one after the other. This PR fixes that by spawning all JSON patching operations in a separate blocking async task. This allows other async tasks to continue.

Fix #215

title: feat: more derives for conda lock
body:
This adds some small changes to the conda-lock code to:

* Use FXhash for maps
* Add `Eq`, `PartialEq`, `Clone`, `Debug`, `Hash` to datastructures that support it.
* Add the `Ordered<_>` `serde_as` helper to make sure fields are serialized deterministically.

title: improve version parse error msg
body: I made the mistake of adding `=>1.2.3` which is very much illegal but it was not really clear from the error message

title: feat: alternative libc detection
body:
Implements an alternative method to detect the *system* libc version. 

We ran into an issue that when a binary is build against musl the code was unable to detect the proper libc version of the system. The code used the libc family against which it was built instead. 

Although this implementation is less then ideal because it assumes a few things I think its good enough for now.

title: refactor: version tree parsing with nom
body:
Refactors parsing of version trees by replacing the regex parser with nom. Hopefully, we can reuse these parsers in other parts of the library as well.

Fix #204

title: Add an image to Readme
body: Let's ask the community for their opinion :)

title: feat: add libsolve errors to error message
body:
Going from :
```
error: unsolvable
```


To:
```
error: Cannot solve the request because of: nothing provides requested poopie
```

title: fix: refactor ci to enable building for different targets
body: Refactors the CI stages to build and test for multiple (cross-platform) targets.

title: bump: rust 1.70.0
body: Bump the used rust version to 1.70.0

title: feature: make it possible to deserialize virtual packages
body: Used to help with the parsing of the virtual package from toml

title: JLAP support
ignore trailing .0 in version comparison
body: Not sure if this is the cleanest way of implementing this behavior, but in order to fix #194 we need to ignore trailing `0` when comparing versions for equality.

title: Change blake2 hash to use `blake2b` instead of `blake2s`
body:
While working on the [JLAP implementation](https://github.com/mamba-org/rattler/issues/81), I discovered that the `blake2` hash that `rattle_repodata_gateway` generates isn't compatible with the ones found in the `repodata.jlap` files currently being generated by the server (rattler uses `blake2s` and JLAP uses `blake2b`).

This pull request switches `rattler_repodata_gateway` to use `blake2b`.

Comments and suggestions for improvements welcome.

title: Small fixes for link.json parsing, and making entry point template public
Adding documentation example, fixing typo
body: While going through the code in preparation for completing this issue https://github.com/mamba-org/rattler/issues/81, I thought it would be nice to add a working example to the crate documentation. I also fixed a typo I found.

title: feat: add a dynamic shell type and simple discovery
body:
Adds `ShellEnum`: an enum to enable "dynamic" dispatch for shell types.
Adds the possibility to discover the default shell for the current platform. (Super dumb)
Adds a method to invoke a shell script.

title: fix: less strict checking of identical packages in transaction
body: If package records dont match exactly but they do refer to the same content the transaction considers them to be equal. This is useful because when installing from a lock file instead of from repodata the records don't completely contain the same information. However, they do contain enough information to know that they refer to the same content.

title: feat: nameless match spec
body: Nameless match spec is matchspec without a package name. This is useful when you describe specs as an object instead of as an array. Since in the matchspec syntax the name could be in several places in the text representation parsing on nameless matchspec takes on a simpler form.

title: fix: small issues I encountered
body: Small issues I encountered

title: fix: add missin spec types
body: Exposing missing types to be able to construct `VersionSpecs`.

title: fix: sparse requires raw_value
body: When using the `sparse` feature you also need the `serde_json/raw_value` feature.

title: add tls features to rattler dependencies as well
body: I think this is needed.

title: Add "sorted" macro to JSON data types
body: fixes: #125

title: expose reqwest tls features
body: I am not very sure about this -- would love a review :)

title: feat: extract python json formatter
body:
I extracted the Python json formatter code to a separate crate: https://github.com/prefix-dev/serde-json-python-formatter 

This PR integrates that crate.

Fixes: https://github.com/mamba-org/rattler/issues/168

title: feat: compute hashes while extracting
body:
This computes the hashes of extracted archives on the fly. I _think_ this is really fast and shouldn't add much overhead (compared to disk and network access) but we can also put it behind flags that we pass in. Or we can separate this concern into different functions. However, I also think its good practice to check the hash of the downloaded file to ensure consistency so 🤷 

Let me know what you think!

Fixes: https://github.com/mamba-org/rattler/issues/41

title: fix: allow downloading of repodata.json to fail for arch specific channels
body:
Allow not-found errors for arch specific repodata channels.

This is not the cleanest implementation but we'll have to refactor this part at some point anyway.

title: Allow setting timestamp when writing archives
body:
I cobbled something together to help build "reproducible" archives. 

This deterministically sets the timestamp of all files in an archive. That worked for a quick test of building a reproducible package :)

However, we could come up with more interesting schemes of modifying the timestamps (e.g. only forcing the timestamp on files that have been written in the past 24 hours or so, and leave those files that were just copied from the source archive as they are).

Some references: https://reproducible-builds.org/docs/timestamps/

title: make ParseError public and reuse ArchiveType
body:
I couldn't use `ParseMatchSpecError` in another `#[derive(thiserror)]` because the module wasn't pub. We could also specifically re-export the error only at another level?

lmk what you think

title: Add .arch function
body:
Note: 

- I also had a version that wrote out all options
- We could also implement a stricter type for `Arch`

- I think we should also implement a catch-all platform (`Unknown(String)`) to facilitate adding new platforms easily

title: fix: typo libsolve -> libsolv
body: Fix typo in the previous PR

title: Improve getting started with a micromamba environment.
body: After having a conversation in our discord it became very obvious we should have an environment.yml that specifies the dependencies to compile Rattler.

title: bump: update bindgen requirement from 0.64.0 to 0.65.1
body:
Updates the requirements on [bindgen](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust-bindgen) to permit the latest version.
Changelog

Sourced from bindgen's changelog.

0.65.1

Fixed

  • The Builder::rustfmt_bindings method was added back and tagged as deprecated instead of being removed.
  • Broken documentation links were fixed.

0.65.0

Added

  • Added the Builder::default_visibility method and the --default-visibility flag to set the default visibility of fields. (#2338)
  • Added the --formatter CLI flag with the values none, rustfmt and prettyplease to select which tool will be used to format the bindings. The default value is rustfmt. (#2453)
  • Added the Builder::formatter method and the Formatter type to select which tool will be used to format the bindings. (#2453)
  • Added the Builder::emit_diagnostics method and the --emit-diagnostics flag to enable emission of diagnostic messages under the experimental feature. (#2436)
  • Added support for the "efiapi" calling convention (#2490).
  • Added the ParseCallbacks::read_env_var method which runs everytime bindgen reads and environment variable. (#2400)
  • Added the ParseCallbacks::generated_link_name_override method which allow overriding the link name of items. (#2425)
  • Add support for C enums when generating code while using the --wrap-static-fns feature. (#2415)

Changed

  • Static functions with no arguments use void as their single argument instead of having no arguments when the --wrap-static-fns flag is used. (#2443)
  • The source file generated when the --wrap-static-fns flag is enabled now contains #include directives with all the input headers and all the source code added with the header_contents method. (#2447)
  • The source file generated when the --wrap-static-fns flag no longer uses asm labeling and the link name of static wrapper functions is allowed to be mangled. (#2448)
  • The documentation of the generated type aliases now matches the comments of their typedef counterparts instead of using the comments of the aliased types. (#2463)
  • The Builder::rustfmt_bindings methods and the --no-rustfmt-bindings flag are now deprecated in favor of the formatter API. (#2453)

Removed

  • The following deprecated flags were removed: --use-msvc-mangling, --rustfmt-bindings and --size_t-is-usize. (#2408)
  • The Bindings::emit_warnings and Bindings::warnings methods were removed in favor of --emit-diagnostics. (#2436)

... (truncated)

Commits
  • 7d24305 Prepare to release 0.65.1 (#2496)
  • d9996ab Fix Clippy lints (#2495)
  • d0d3448 Improve documentation about regex (#2494)
  • fa8dd50 Add docs workflow (#2493)
  • 2bcff0f Prepare to release 0.65.0 (#2492)
  • 54bf9ca Make prettyplease non-optional (#2491)
  • 5d1c79a bindgen::ParseCallbacks: support tracking env variable usage for cargo (#2400)
  • 1e3e25f Document efiapi ABI stabilization (#2490)
  • 594eb7b Add support for the "efiapi" ABI. (#2481)
  • dcc21c1 Don't generate wrong strings. (#2487)
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

title: fix: couple file_mode and prefix_placeholder
add more targets to target detection
body: Tried to run rattler in a devcontainer on a M1 :)

title: feat: generate bindings statically
body:
This PR adds a new crate "tools" which contains commands to perform code generation commands and the like. There is currently only a single command `gen-libsolv-bindings` which will generate the libsolv bindings from the libsolv source code. The bindings are now part of the source code instead of being generated every time you build the `rattler-solv` crate.

This eliminates the dependency on `bindgen` and with that, the dependency on `clang-sys`  when using the `rattler-solv` crate. This should make it much easier to build the code for targets that don't have a runtime version of clang available (like musl or wasm).

A test is also included that checks whether the bindings are still up to date to ensure we don't use out-of-date bindings by accident.

title: feat: construction methods for NoArchType
body:
Fixes: #129 

This PR adds several methods to construct the `NoArchType` struct.

https://github.com/conda/conda-index/blob/90879f56e23b1d7b1c14fa632f5d20163130dfc8/conda_index/index/__init__.py#L218

  • eeb9b51 Update rstest_test dependencies and publish new version 0.10.0

  • 478baa1 Fix #176
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

title: fix: move libsolv to crate level for publishing
feat: better readme
body: [rendered](https://github.com/baszalmstra/rattler/blob/feat/update_readme/README.md)

title: feat: replace zulip with discord
body: This replaces the zulip icon with discord!

title: fix: null values are still values
body: Make sure that entries that are "null" are still stored correctly.

title: feat: add datastructures for repodata patches
body: Adds datastructures for repodata patches

title: fix setting conda disttype to pool for proper constraint handling and…
body: … more

title: add package writing functions
body: This adds some low-level package write functions. Unfortunately the zstd writing doesn't work for some reason (seems to write a partial file for the first file and 0 bytes for the second) and I don't know why :)

title: fix: sort entries by package name in sparse index
body:
Fixes an issue where records from other packages were returned when searching the sparse index.

See the explanation in the code.

title: feat: extra methods to query spare repodata
body:
* Sometimes `repodata.json` files dont include the `subdir` field for their entries. This PR adds this information back when using the sparse index.
* Adds a method to query the package names that exist in a spare repodata.json file.
* Adds a method to download only the entries for a specific package without also loading its dependencies.
* Renamed some functions to include the recursive nature.

title: feat: enable downloading repodata_from_patches.json
body: Enable downloading of `repodata_from_packages.json` with the `fetch_repo_data` function.

title: feat: add some missing fields
body:
Adds some fields that were missing from package records. 

Also made the version and timestamp of channeldata packages optional since apparently, they don't all contain those fields..

title: rename SolverProblem to SolverTask
body: I think this will make it easier to differentiate vs. our `solver_problem` functions that return problems with the solving process (e.g. package not found etc.).

title: get rid of some more usize -> u64
add features and track_features to index.json
fix: include libsolv error message in unsolvable variant
fix: robustly handle NUL in repodata.json
body: Fixes #98

title: Solve problems
body: This PR parses solver problems into a vector of enums. We need to post process that list of problems into a graph, then compress it and print it to get similar error messages as with `libmamba` :)

title: fix: sparse index returns duplicate records
body: Fixes an issue where the sparse index loader returns duplicate records if you mention the same package multiple times.

title: feat: add win-arm64 as a known platform
body: Adds `win-arm64` as a known platform.

title: fix: issue with forward slash on windows
body: Fixes an issue where backslashes should be replaced with forward slashes when replacing prefixes on windows. This is to make sure we don't accidentally introduce wrongly escaped characters if the prefix is used inside of a string literal. This works on windows since both forward- and backslashes are accepted directory separators. The same technique is employed by both micromamba and conda.

title: Matchspec impl
body:
I ported over some of your code from the `pubgrub` branch, @baszalmstra :)

I should actually attribute the PR to you, sry! Would be interested what you think about the `StringMatcher` and if you have ideas on the build number matcher we might want to build.

title: feat: implement sparse repodata loading
body: This implements loading specific records of the repodata instead of loading all the data, significantly improving solving performance.

title: Feat/write conda lock
body:
Add support from writing from the conda-lock datastructures into yaml. This is the first step because it's still bare-bones serialization. We do include the initial part of the content_hash calculation though, which was a bit difficult to reverse engineer.

Currently, I'm only allowing the write of fields I think we will use, we can also extend those later.

We are still missing, but I want to do this in a next PR:

- [ ] Create conda lock from Vec<RepodataRecord> so that we can use it in the create for example
- [ ] Add default virtual packages for a canonical lock file.
- [ ] Add virtual packages to the content_hash, and see if we can get similar output for the python conda-lock and our version.

title: feat: allow caching repodata.json as .solv file
body:
The two first commits contain fixes that were necessary to use rattler to solve conda environments in a standalone application: `ChannelInfo` is used in one of `RepoData`'s public fields, so it makes sense to make it public too; making the `dowload_progress` closure `Send` and `Sync` ensures we can download `repodata.json` in an async context.

The third commit adds functionality to cache repodata.json for libsolv, which results in huge speedups (solve `python` in ~300ms on my machine, instead of >2000ms). I am not totally satisfied with the modifications to the `SolverBackend` trait, but I couldn't find a better way of expressing what I wanted in the current type system (maybe `impl Trait` in traits would help here, but the feature is currently unstable). Also, the conditional compilation side of things is a bit ugly, but as long as it stays properly encapsulated inside the libsolv wrapper I think it is tolerable.

title: feat: add riscv
body: Adds Riscv as known targets.

title: feat: install python entry points
body: Reads the `link.json` file during install and creates Python entry points in parallel with the rest of the files.

title: matchspec & version docs
body:
I think we should attribute the original conda documentation/files that these were taken from. 

@baszalmstra do you want to check the matchspec parsing? some of the examples didn't work because of a `BracketsError`.

title: Docs for all the conda types in crate
body: Apply `#![deny(docs_missing)]` and add all the missing docs.

title: Link json
body: Turns out we were missing `link.json` parsing and are also currently not creating entry points for `noarch`-Python packages. That will come in another PR! :)

title: bump: update tower-http requirement from 0.3.5 to 0.4.0
body:
Updates the requirements on [tower-http](https://github.com/tower-rs/tower-http) to permit the latest version.
Release notes

Sourced from tower-http's releases.

v0.4.0

Added

  • decompression: Add RequestDecompression middleware (#282)
  • compression: Implement Default for CompressionBody (#323)
  • compression, decompression: Support zstd (de)compression (#322)

Changed

  • serve_dir: ServeDir and ServeFile's error types are now Infallible and any IO errors will be converted into responses. Use try_call to generate error responses manually (BREAKING) (#283)
  • serve_dir: ServeDir::fallback and ServeDir::not_found_service now requires the fallback service to use Infallible as its error type (BREAKING) (#283)
  • compression, decompression: Tweak prefered compression encodings (#325)

Removed

  • Removed RequireAuthorization in favor of ValidateRequest (BREAKING) (#290)

Fixed

  • serve_dir: Don't include identity in Content-Encoding header (#317)
  • compression: Do compress SVGs (#321)
  • serve_dir: In ServeDir, convert io::ErrorKind::NotADirectory to 404 Not Found (#331)

#282: tower-rs/tower-http#282 #283: tower-rs/tower-http#283 #290: tower-rs/tower-http#290 #317: tower-rs/tower-http#317 #321: tower-rs/tower-http#321 #322: tower-rs/tower-http#322 #323: tower-rs/tower-http#323 #325: tower-rs/tower-http#325 #331: tower-rs/tower-http#331

Commits
  • 842cf89 Release 0.4.0 (#332)
  • bc57dee add missing changelog links
  • e399df9 update changelog
  • 67130ab Request decompression (#282)
  • f3d8528 Impl Default for CompressionBody when possible (#323)
  • 255c28e Support zstd (de)compression (#322)
  • 987f5c9 ServeDir: convert io::ErrorKind::NotADirectory to not_found (#331)
  • a6d0f7b Prefer encoding: brotli > gzip > deflate (#325)
  • e941dee Do compress SVGs (#321)
  • b6434e7 Update changelog
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

title: feat: stateless solver
body:
This modifies the solver API to be more "stateless". Instead of specifying what is installed and the solver telling you what to change, the solver now always returns the "desired state". Transforming an installed environment into the desired state is left up to the consumer instead.

I changed the previous behavior (which is similar to Mamba) to make it easier for tools to create "clean" environments where no packages remain from a previous installation. This was previously only possible by determining the exact specs that went into creating an environment (which would imply adding a history). The API should still enable tools to work "incrementally" by modifying the installation behavior instead of the solver behavior.

I also think this refactor will make it easier to integrate different solvers because they do not need to take care of the "transaction" anymore.

 #72 (which already incorporates these changes) contains code to construct a `Transaction` from an installed environment and the result of solving.

@aochagavia This one might be particularly interesting to you! Especially the `SolveGoal`.

Code taken from #72 to split it up a bit.

title: fix: repodata cache was always out of date
body:
Fixes an issue where the cache was always out of date because the check was reversed. 🙈 

Code taken from https://github.com/mamba-org/rattler/pull/72 to split it up a bit.
